review: EDIT: April 04, 2015. If I unplug the Fire Stick for a while and the plug it back in, it seems to work. I do not use it often. But today I tried to watch basketball on TBS on Sling TV. It buffered endlessly on my Roku, my IPad, my laptop, and my PC. In desperation I tried the Fire Stick. It works without buffering. Fire Stick to the rescue. I am watching the game in the second half as I write this.The game is over. I am watching the post game. It did not buffer once. I like my Fire Stick! I once hated it.******************My first review.I signed up for three months of Sling TV and received a free Fire Stick as part of a promotional campaign. I am glad that I did not pay for the Fire Stick. It worked well for two days. Now, it does not want to recognize my home network.It says that Home is currently unavailable.  I unplug it and plug it back in and that does not work. My PC in the same room is connected to my network. I put in my Chromecast in the same television and it works. I tried the XBox to the same TV and it connects. My IPad connects. The Fire Stick is the only product that does not connect.The error message tells me to go to settings. I go to settings. Every time I try to manually connect  it goes back to the first step. There is nothing wrong with my network. My router is working. Other gadgets connect to the internet to the same TV.I guess I will box it up and put it in a drawer, where it will stay until I throw it away. I was really hoping that it would work.
author: Utah Pete
